Tanjim Abubokor

about.description:
Hello there! My name is Tanjim Abubokor. I am a web designer & developer, and I'm very passionate and dedicated to my work.

With 20 years experience as a professional a graphic designer, I have acquired the skills and knowledge necessary to make your project a success. I enjoy every step of the design process, from discussion and collaboration.

skills.subtitle: Web Development
skills.text: Website development is the process of building, programming, coding and maintaining websites and web applications.
skills.description:
Elisc is a leading web design agency with an award-winning design team that creates innovative, effective websites that capture your brand, improve your conversion rates, and maximize your revenue to help grow your business and achieve your goals.

In today’s digital world, your website is the first interaction consumers have with your business. That's why almost 95 percent of a user’s first impression relates to web design. It’s also why web design services can have an immense impact on your company’s bottom line.

That’s why more companies are not only reevaluating their website’s design but also partnering with Elisc, the web design agency that’s driven more than $2.4 billion in revenue for its clients. With over 50 web design awards under our belt, we're confident we can design a custom website that drives sales for your unique business.

blogs.title: Unleashing the Power of Django Cache: Boosting Performance and Efficiency
blogs.description:
In the fast-paced world of web development, optimizing performance is key to delivering a seamless user experience. One powerful tool in the Django framework that can significantly enhance your application's speed and efficiency is caching. In this blog post, we'll explore why caching is crucial, how it benefits us, and delve into practical steps on implementing it in your Django projects.

- Why Cache Matters:
Caching is like a supercharged memory that stores frequently accessed data, reducing the need to repeatedly fetch it from the original source. This not only accelerates response times but also minimizes server load, making your application more scalable.

- Benefits of Caching:
1. Faster Response Times: Caching allows your application to retrieve data quickly, enhancing user experience by reducing latency.

2. Reduced Server Load: By storing and serving cached content, your server handles fewer requests, freeing up resources for other tasks.

2. Improved Scalability: Caching contributes to better scalability, enabling your application to handle increased traffic without sacrificing performance.

- Using Django Cache:
Django provides a robust caching framework that is easy to implement. Here's a simple guide to get you started:

1. Configure Django Cache Settings:
In your Django project's settings.py, configure the cache backend. Adjust the settings based on your preferred cache backend (e.g., Memcached, Redis).

2. DecorateViewswith @cache_page:
Apply caching to specific views using the cache_page decorator.

3. Use Django's Low-Level Cache API:
For more control, leverage Django's low-level cache API.
